content: 2nd chain from hook 4 single_crochet slip_stitch to join this round only round 2 4 single_crochet in each single_crochet 4 single_crochet slip_stitch to join last round only leave 12 tail to sew tail to body fasten_off fig 3 © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved - 3 - shasta the hippo finishing 1 stuff body do not sew shut you may wish to put some plastic pellets in the bottom of the body before stuffing to add some weight and stability if you do i recommend placing the pellets inside a small fabric pouch before putting them in the body otherwise they are likely to eventually fall out between the spaces of the single crochets this is not only messy but also a potential choking hazard for small children i cut two circles roughly 3 in diameter from scrap fabric sew them together leaving a 1 opening fill the pouch with a scant ¼ cup of pellets and then slip-stitch the opening shut 2 sew head to body using inside loops only of last round of body 3 stuff arms lightly and sew to body 4 stuff muzzle and sew to head using inside loops only of last round of muzzle 5 weave ends in ears and then sew ears to head i usually sew them between round 8 & 9 pinch the bottom of the ear together as you sew it to make the ears pointy see fig 5 6 sew tail to body fig 4 7 sew felt eyes to face alternatively embroider eyes to face 8 embroider eyebrows nose and mouth i use french knots for the nose fig 5 © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved - 4 - shasta the hippo fig 1 fig 2 fig 3 fig 4 fig 5 © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved - 5 -
